bill_title: establish a tribal flag display on the capitol grounds.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to establish a tribal flag display on the capitol grounds. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 5-15 be amended by adding a NEW SECTION to read: The official flag of each of the nine federally recognized Indian tribes in this state shall be displayed in a suitable place on the capitol grounds to be determined by the commission. The Legislature shall hold a ceremony open to the public to honor and recognize the flag display during each legislative session and representation from each branch of state government and from each tribe with a flag on display shall be invited to participate. 100 copies were printed on recycled paper by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.167 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.

action_log.status_text: Withdrawn at the Request of the Prime Sponsor
